description: Restrict carbohydrate intake to improve glycemic control in diabetes

carbohydrates_percent.note: Maximum 45% of total calories from carbohydrates

conflict_resolution: Take most restrictive constraint when multiple rules apply
source_reference: ADA Standards of Medical Care in Diabetes 2024, Section 5: Facilitating Behavior Change and Well-being to Improve Health Outcomes

description: Limit sodium intake to reduce blood pressure in hypertension
conflict_resolution: Take most restrictive sodium limit
source_reference: AHA Scientific Statement: Dietary Sodium and Cardiovascular Disease Risk (2021)

description: Modify fat intake to improve lipid profile in dyslipidemia

saturated_fat_percent.note: Maximum 7% of total calories from saturated fat

monounsaturated_fat_percent.note: Minimum 10% from monounsaturated fats (olive oil, nuts)

conflict_resolution: Take most restrictive fat constraints
source_reference: AHA Scientific Statement: Dietary Fats and Cardiovascular Disease (2017)

description: Create calorie deficit for weight loss in obesity

calories.note: 20% calorie deficit from TDEE for weight loss

meal_distribution.note: Regular meal pattern to prevent overeating

conflict_resolution: Take higher deficit percentage if multiple rules apply
source_reference: AND Adult Weight Management Evidence-Based Nutrition Practice Guideline (2014)

description: Increase dietary fiber intake for optimal health

fiber_g.note: Minimum 25g dietary fiber per day for adults

conflict_resolution: Take higher minimum if multiple rules apply
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Health Implications of Dietary Fiber (2015)

description: Ensure adequate protein intake for muscle maintenance and metabolic function

protein_percent.note: Minimum 20% of total calories from protein

protein_g_per_kg.note: Minimum 0.8g protein per kg body weight

conflict_resolution: Take higher minimum if multiple rules apply
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Protein and Exercise (2016)

description: Nutrition therapy to prevent progression from prediabetes to diabetes
conflict_resolution: Take most restrictive constraint
source_reference: ADA Standards of Medical Care in Diabetes 2024, Section 3: Prevention or Delay of Type 2 Diabetes

description: Increase calorie and nutrient intake for healthy weight gain

calories.note: 10% calorie surplus from TDEE for healthy weight gain

meal_distribution.note: Frequent small meals for better tolerance

conflict_resolution: Take higher surplus if multiple rules apply
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Nutrition Intervention in the Treatment of Eating Disorders (2011)

description: Maintain stable blood glucose levels through carbohydrate consistency and insulin-matched nutrition.

carbohydrates_percent.note: Moderate carbohydrate intake with consistent distribution per meal to match insulin dosing

meal_distribution.note: Regular meals with planned snacks to prevent hypoglycemia

conflict_resolution: Glycemic control overrides weight-loss focused rules
source_reference: ADA Standards of Care in Diabetes 2024

description: Support insulin sensitivity, hormonal balance, and inflammation control in PCOS.

carbohydrates_percent.note: Focus on low-GI carbohydrates to reduce insulin spikes

protein_percent.note: Higher protein supports insulin sensitivity and satiety

meal_distribution.note: Balanced meals to support hormonal regulation

conflict_resolution: Follow diabetes rules first if comorbid diabetes exists
source_reference: PCOS Clinical Practice Guideline (2018)

description: Ensure iodine and selenium adequacy while managing goitrogen intake.

iodine_mcg.note: Ensure sufficient iodine intake 150-1100mcg/day (RDA 150mcg), avoid excess (>1100mcg)

conflict_resolution: CKD-related mineral restrictions take precedence
source_reference: ATA Hypothyroidism Guidelines

description: Reduce fermentable carbohydrates to control IBS symptoms.
conflict_resolution: IBD rules override IBS rules if both present
source_reference: ACG IBS Guideline (2021)

description: Modify protein, sodium, potassium, and phosphorus intake based on CKD stage.

protein_g_per_kg.note: Protein intake adjusted based on eGFR (stages 3-5: 0.6-0.8g/kg/day)

sodium_mg.note: Sodium restriction ≤2000mg/day for blood pressure and fluid control

potassium_mg.note: Potassium restriction ≤2000mg/day if serum levels are elevated (stage 3-5)

phosphorus_mg.note: Phosphorus restriction ≤1000mg/day required for stages 3-5 to prevent bone disease

meal_distribution.note: Avoid large protein loads per meal

conflict_resolution: CKD rules override all other macro rules
source_reference: KDIGO CKD Nutrition Guidelines (2023)

display_name: Sugar and Fat Modification for Fatty Liver Disease
description: Reduce hepatic fat accumulation by limiting simple sugars and improving fat quality.

added_sugars_percent.note: Maximum 5% of total calories from added sugars

conflict_resolution: Diabetes-related sugar limits take precedence
source_reference: NAFLD/NASH Practice Guidance (2023)

description: Support bone density through adequate calcium, vitamin D, and protein intake.

protein_percent.note: Adequate protein (minimum 15% calories) supports bone matrix

calcium_mg.note: Adequate calcium intake ≥1000mg/day for bone health

vitamin_D_IU.note: Vitamin D ≥800IU/day supports calcium absorption and bone health

conflict_resolution: CKD-related mineral limits override calcium targets
source_reference: Clinician’s Guide to Osteoporosis (2022)

description: Support gut healing, reduce inflammation, and prevent malnutrition in inflammatory bowel disease.

protein_g_per_kg.note: Higher protein needs (1.2-1.5g/kg/day) due to inflammation and tissue repair

iron_mg.note: Monitor and ensure adequate iron intake (RDA 18mg/day for women, 8mg/day for men)

meal_distribution.note: Small frequent meals to reduce gut burden

conflict_resolution: IBD rules override IBS and GERD rules during active disease
source_reference: ECCO Guidelines on Nutrition in IBD (2023)

description: Reduce cardiovascular risk by improving lipid profile, blood pressure, and overall metabolic health.

saturated_fat_percent.note: Limit saturated fat to ≤7% of calories to reduce LDL cholesterol

sodium_mg.note: Sodium restriction ≤2000mg/day for blood pressure control

meal_distribution.note: Balanced meal timing supports lipid control

conflict_resolution: CKD sodium and fat restrictions take precedence if present
source_reference: AHA Dietary Guidance for Cardiovascular Health (2021)

display_name: Iron Repletion Nutrition for Iron Deficiency Anemia
description: Improve hemoglobin and iron stores through dietary iron optimization and absorption enhancement.

iron_mg.note: Increase iron intake (RDA 18mg/day women, 8mg/day men). Prefer heme iron sources where applicable

vitamin_C_mg.note: Ensure adequate vitamin C (≥65mg/day) to enhance iron absorption

meal_distribution.note: Pair iron foods with vitamin C sources

conflict_resolution: Iron deficiency rules override calorie restriction rules
source_reference: WHO Guidelines on Iron Deficiency Anemia (2020)

description: Support red blood cell production through iron, vitamin B12, folate, and protein adequacy.

protein_percent.note: Adequate protein supports red blood cell production

iron_mg.note: Adequate iron required for red blood cell production (RDA 18mg/day women, 8mg/day men)

vitamin_B12_mcg.note: Adequate B12 required for red blood cell production (RDA 2.4mcg/day)

folate_mcg.note: Adequate folate required for red blood cell production (RDA 400mcg/day)

conflict_resolution: Iron deficiency–specific rules override generic anemia rules
source_reference: WHO Nutritional Anemias Report

description: Reduce gastric irritation and support healing of the stomach lining.

meal_distribution.note: Small frequent meals reduce gastric acid load

conflict_resolution: Gastritis rules override GERD and weight loss rules during active symptoms
source_reference: ACG Clinical Guideline on Gastritis

description: Reduce acid reflux symptoms through trigger avoidance, meal timing, and portion control.

fat_percent.note: Limit fat intake (≤30% calories) as high-fat meals worsen reflux

meal_distribution.note: Avoid late-night meals; last meal 2–3 hours before sleep

conflict_resolution: GERD rules override obesity calorie rules for meal timing
source_reference: ACG GERD Clinical Guideline (2022)
